poem:
**In Defence of Orchards**

Lost in the landscape, a harvest of whispers,  
trees stooped under burdens of sweet history.  
In every apple, a chapter, a droplet of time—  
pressed into memory, sun-trapped and earthy.  
Fieldsmoke rises where orchards once stood,  
roots untethered, a cider dream fading in the  
palm of the countryside, begging to be cradled.
